Events.text: Dong Zhuo is assassinated by his adopted son Lü Bu.
Events.html: Dong Zhuo is assassinated by his adopted son Lü Bu.

Events.text: Fourteenth recorded perihelion passage of Halley's Comet.
Events.html: Fourteenth recorded perihelion passage of Halley's Comet.

Events.text: A Byzantine fleet sacks and destroys the undefended Damietta in Egypt.
Events.html: A Byzantine fleet sacks and destroys the undefended Damietta in Egypt.

Events.text: The Hashshashin (Assassins) attempt to murder Saladin near Aleppo.
Events.html: The Hashshashin (Assassins) attempt to murder Saladin near Aleppo.

Events.text: King John of England and King Philip II of France sign the Treaty of Le Goulet.
Events.html: King John of England and King Philip II of France sign the Treaty of Le Goulet.

Events.text: Henry Raspe is elected anti-king of the Kingdom of Germany, in opposition to Conrad IV.
Events.html: Henry Raspe is elected anti-king of the Kingdom of Germany, in opposition to Conrad IV.

Events.text: Serbian King Stefan Uroš I and the Republic of Venice sign a peace treaty.
Events.html: Serbian King Stefan Uroš I and the Republic of Venice sign a peace treaty.

Events.text: The Brussels massacre: Several Jews are murdered and the rest of the Jewish community is banished from Brussels.
Events.html: The Brussels massacre: Several Jews are murdered and the rest of the Jewish community is banished from Brussels.

Events.text: Pope Gregory XI issues five papal bulls to denounce the doctrines of English theologian John Wycliffe.
Events.html: Pope Gregory XI issues five papal bulls to denounce the doctrines of English theologian John Wycliffe.

Events.text: Start of the Wars of the Roses: At the First Battle of St Albans, Richard, Duke of York, defeats and captures King Henry VI of England.
Events.html: Start of the Wars of the Roses: At the First Battle of St Albans, Richard, Duke of York, defeats and captures King Henry VI of England.

links.title: Richard of York, 3rd Duke of York

Events.text: The first atlas, Theatrum Orbis Terrarum, is published with 70 maps.
Events.html: The first atlas, Theatrum Orbis Terrarum, is published with 70 maps.

Events.text: Holy Roman Emperor Ferdinand II and Danish King Christian IV sign the Treaty of Lübeck to end the Danish intervention in the Thirty Years' War.
Events.html: Holy Roman Emperor Ferdinand II and Danish King Christian IV sign the Treaty of Lübeck to end the Danish intervention in the Thirty Years' War.

Events.text: Sweden and Prussia sign the Treaty of Hamburg.
Events.html: Sweden and Prussia sign the Treaty of Hamburg.

Events.text: Trevi Fountain in Rome is officially completed and inaugurated by Pope Clement XIII.
Events.html: 1762 – Trevi Fountain in Rome is officially completed and inaugurated by Pope Clement XIII.

Events.text: The Lewis and Clark Expedition officially began as the Corps of Discovery departed from St. Charles, Missouri.
Events.html: The Lewis and Clark Expedition officially began as the Corps of Discovery departed from St. Charles, Missouri.

Events.text: A grand jury indicts former Vice President of the United States Aaron Burr on a charge of treason.
Events.html: A grand jury indicts former Vice President of the United States Aaron Burr on a charge of treason.

links.title: Vice President of the United States

Events.text: On the second and last day of the Battle of Aspern-Essling (near Vienna, Austria), Napoleon I is repelled by an enemy army for the first time.
Events.html: On the second and last day of the Battle of Aspern-Essling (near Vienna, Austria), Napoleon I is repelled by an enemy army for the first time.

Events.text: A mob in Littleport, Cambridgeshire, England, riots over high unemployment and rising grain costs, which spreads to Ely the next day.
Events.html: A mob in Littleport, Cambridgeshire, England, riots over high unemployment and rising grain costs, which spreads to Ely the next day.

Events.text: The SS Savannah leaves port at Savannah, Georgia, United States, on a voyage to become the first steamship to cross the Atlantic Ocean.
Events.html: The SS Savannah leaves port at Savannah, Georgia, United States, on a voyage to become the first steamship to cross the Atlantic Ocean.

Events.text: HMS Beagle departs on its first voyage.
Events.html: HMS Beagle departs on its first voyage.

Events.text: The transportation of British convicts to the New South Wales colony is abolished.
Events.html: The transportation of British convicts to the New South Wales colony is abolished.

Events.text: Slavery is abolished in Martinique.
Events.html: Slavery is abolished in Martinique.

Events.text: Future U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is issued a patent for an invention to lift boats, making him the only U.S. President to ever hold a patent.
Events.html: Future U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is issued a patent for an invention to lift boats, making him the only U.S. President to ever hold a patent.

Events.text: Congressman Preston Brooks of South Carolina severely beats Senator Charles Sumner of Massachusetts with a cane in the hall of the United States Senate for a speech Sumner had made regarding Southerners and slavery.
Events.html: Congressman Preston Brooks of South Carolina severely beats Senator Charles Sumner of Massachusetts with a cane in the hall of the United States Senate for a speech Sumner had made regarding Southerners and slavery.

Events.text: American Civil War: Union forces begin the Siege of Port Hudson which lasts 48 days, the longest siege in U.S. military history.
Events.html: American Civil War: Union forces begin the Siege of Port Hudson which lasts 48 days, the longest siege in U.S. military history.

Events.text: American Civil War: After ten weeks, the Union Army's Red River Campaign ends in failure.
Events.html: American Civil War: After ten weeks, the Union Army's Red River Campaign ends in failure.

Events.text: Reconstruction Era: President Ulysses S. Grant signs the Amnesty Act into law, restoring full civil and political rights to all but about 500 Confederate sympathizers.
Events.html: Reconstruction Era: President Ulysses S. Grant signs the Amnesty Act into law, restoring full civil and political rights to all but about 500 Confederate sympathizers.

Events.text: The Associated Press is formed in New York City as a non-profit news cooperative.
Events.html: The Associated Press is formed in New York City as a non-profit news cooperative.

Events.text: The Wright brothers are granted U.S. patent number 821,393 for their "Flying-Machine".
Events.html: The Wright brothers are granted U.S. patent number 821,393 for their "Flying-Machine".

Events.text: Lassen Peak erupts with a powerful force, the only volcano other than Mount St. Helens to erupt in the contiguous U.S. during the 20th century.
Events.html: Lassen Peak erupts with a powerful force, the only volcano other than Mount St. Helens to erupt in the contiguous U.S. during the 20th century.

Events.text: Three trains collide in the Quintinshill rail disaster near Gretna Green, Scotland, killing 227 people and injuring 246.
Events.html: 1915 – Three trains collide in the Quintinshill rail disaster near Gretna Green, Scotland, killing 227 people and injuring 246.

Events.text: Chiang Kai-shek replaces communists in Kuomintang China.
Events.html: Chiang Kai-shek replaces communists in Kuomintang China.

Events.text: Near Xining, China, a 8.3 quake causes 200,000 deaths in one of the world's most destructive earthquakes.
Events.html: Near Xining, China, a 8.3 quake causes 200,000 deaths in one of the world's most destructive earthquakes.

Events.text: World War II: Germany and Italy sign the Pact of Steel.
Events.html: World War II: Germany and Italy sign the Pact of Steel.

Events.text: During the Anglo-Iraqi War, British troops take Fallujah.
Events.html: During the Anglo-Iraqi War, British troops take Fallujah.

Events.text: Mexico enters World War II on the side of the Allies.
Events.html: Mexico enters World War II on the side of the Allies.

Events.text: Joseph Stalin disbands the Comintern.
Events.html: Joseph Stalin disbands the Comintern.

Events.text: The Truman Doctrine goes into effect, aiding Turkey & Greece.
Events.html: The Truman Doctrine goes into effect, aiding Turkey & Greece.

Events.text: South Africa's government approves racial separation in universities.
Events.html: South Africa's government approves racial separation in universities.

Events.text: The 1958 riots in Ceylon become a watershed in the race relationship of various ethnic communities of Sri Lanka. The total deaths is estimated at 300, mostly Tamils.
Events.html: The 1958 riots in Ceylon become a watershed in the race relationship of various ethnic communities of Sri Lanka. The total deaths is estimated at 300, mostly Tamils.

Events.text: The Great Chilean earthquake, measuring 9.5 on the moment magnitude scale, hits southern Chile. It is the most powerful earthquake ever recorded.
Events.html: The Great Chilean earthquake, measuring 9.5 on the moment magnitude scale, hits southern Chile. It is the most powerful earthquake ever recorded.

Events.text: Continental Airlines Flight 11 crashes after bombs explode on board.
Events.html: Continental Airlines Flight 11 crashes after bombs explode on board.

Events.text: Greek left-wing politician Grigoris Lambrakis is shot in an assassination attempt and dies five days later.
Events.html: Greek left-wing politician Grigoris Lambrakis is shot in an assassination attempt and dies five days later.

Events.text: Lyndon B. Johnson launches the Great Society.
Events.html: Lyndon B. Johnson launches the Great Society.

Events.text: Egypt closes the Straits of Tiran to Israeli shipping.
Events.html: Egypt closes the Straits of Tiran to Israeli shipping.

Events.text: The L'Innovation department store in Brussels, Belgium, burns down, resulting in 323 dead or missing and 150 injured, the most devastating fire in Belgian history.
Events.html: 1967 – The L'Innovation department store in Brussels, Belgium, burns down, resulting in 323 dead or missing and 150 injured, the most devastating fire in Belgian history.

Events.text: The nuclear-powered submarine the USS Scorpion sinks with 99 men aboard, 400 miles southwest of the Azores.
Events.html: The nuclear-powered submarine the USS Scorpion sinks with 99 men aboard, 400 miles southwest of the Azores.

Events.text: Apollo 10's lunar module flies within 8.4 nautical miles (16 km) of the moon's surface.
Events.html: Apollo 10's lunar module flies within 8.4 nautical miles (16 km) of the moon's surface.

Events.text: Ceylon adopts a new constitution, becoming a Republic, changes its name to Sri Lanka, and joins the Commonwealth of Nations.
Events.html: Ceylon adopts a new constitution, becoming a Republic, changes its name to Sri Lanka, and joins the Commonwealth of Nations.

Events.text: Over 400 women in Derry, Northern Ireland attack the offices of Sinn Féin following the shooting by the Irish Republican Army of a young British soldier on leave.
Events.html: 1972 – Over 400 women in Derry, Northern Ireland attack the offices of Sinn Féin following the shooting by the Irish Republican Army of a young British soldier on leave.

Events.text: Hashimpura massacre in Meerut, India.
Events.html: Hashimpura massacre in Meerut, India.

Events.text: First ever Rugby World Cup kicks off with New Zealand playing Italy at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand.
Events.html: 1987 – First ever Rugby World Cup kicks off with New Zealand playing Italy at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand.

Events.text: North and South Yemen are unified to create the Republic of Yemen.
Events.html: North and South Yemen are unified to create the Republic of Yemen.

Events.text: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia and Slovenia join the United Nations.
Events.html: Bosnia and Herzegovina, Croatia and Slovenia join the United Nations.

Events.text: A worldwide trade embargo goes into effect against Haiti to punish its military rulers for not reinstating the country's ousted elected leader, Jean-Bertrand Aristide.
Events.html: A worldwide trade embargo goes into effect against Haiti to punish its military rulers for not reinstating the country's ousted elected leader, Jean-Bertrand Aristide.

Events.text: The Burmese military regime jails 71 supporters of Aung San Suu Kyi in a bid to block a pro-democracy meeting.
Events.html: The Burmese military regime jails 71 supporters of Aung San Suu Kyi in a bid to block a pro-democracy meeting.

Events.text: A U.S. federal judge rules that U.S. Secret Service agents can be compelled to testify before a grand jury concerning the Lewinsky scandal involving President Bill Clinton.
Events.html: A U.S. federal judge rules that U.S. Secret Service agents can be compelled to testify before a grand jury concerning the Lewinsky scandal involving President Bill Clinton.

Events.text: In Sri Lanka, over 150 Tamil rebels are killed over two days of fighting for control in Jaffna.
Events.html: In Sri Lanka, over 150 Tamil rebels are killed over two days of fighting for control in Jaffna.

Events.text: Civil Rights Movement: A jury in Birmingham, Alabama, convicts former Ku Klux Klan member Bobby Frank Cherry of the 1963 murders of four girls in the 16th Street Baptist Church bombing.
Events.html: Civil Rights Movement: A jury in Birmingham, Alabama, convicts former Ku Klux Klan member Bobby Frank Cherry of the 1963 murders of four girls in the 16th Street Baptist Church bombing.

Events.text: An Air India Express Boeing 737 goes over a cliff and crashes upon landing at Mangalore, India, killing 158 of the 166 people on board. It is the worst crash involving a Boeing 737.
Events.html: An Air India Express Boeing 737 goes over a cliff and crashes upon landing at Mangalore, India, killing 158 of the 166 people on board. It is the worst crash involving a Boeing 737.

Events.text: An EF5 tornado strikes Joplin, Missouri, killing 162 people and wreaking $2.8 billion in damage—the costliest and seventh-deadliest single tornado in U.S. history.
Events.html: An EF5 tornado strikes Joplin, Missouri, killing 162 people and wreaking $2.8 billion in damage—the costliest and seventh-deadliest single tornado in U.S. history.

Events.text: Tokyo Skytree opens to the public. It is the tallest tower in the world (634 m), and the second tallest man-made structure on Earth, after Burj Khalifa (829.8 m).
Events.html: Tokyo Skytree opens to the public. It is the tallest tower in the world (634 m), and the second tallest man-made structure on Earth, after Burj Khalifa (829.8 m).

Events.text: General Prayut Chan-o-cha becomes interim leader of Thailand in a military coup d'état, following six months of political turmoil.
Events.html: General Prayut Chan-o-cha becomes interim leader of Thailand in a military coup d'état, following six months of political turmoil.

Events.text: An explosion occurs in Ürümqi, the capital of China's far-western Xinjiang region, resulting in at least 43 deaths and 91 injuries.
Events.html: 2014 – An explosion occurs in Ürümqi, the capital of China's far-western Xinjiang region, resulting in at least 43 deaths and 91 injuries.

Events.text: The Republic of Ireland becomes the first nation in the world to legalize gay marriage in a public referendum.
Events.html: The Republic of Ireland becomes the first nation in the world to legalize gay marriage in a public referendum.

Events.text: 22 people are killed at an Ariana Grande concert in the 2017 Manchester Arena bombing.
Events.html: 22 people are killed at an Ariana Grande concert in the 2017 Manchester Arena bombing.
